meanings.def: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.
examples: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
She never had the least idea what to do about it.
He gave (the) least of all towards the wedding present.
the least of something How others see me is the least of my worries (= I have more important things to worry about).
It's the least I can do to help (= I feel I should do more).

meanings.def: used after amounts to show that the amount is the lowest possible
examples: It'll take a year, at the very least.
Really, I'm not in the least tired.
‘Do you mind if I put the television on?’ ‘No, not in the least.’
Normally I'm not the least bit shy.
He wasn't the slightest bit interested in answering our questions.

meanings.def: without making something seem better, worse, more serious, etc. than it really is
examples: I was surprised, to say the least.

idioms.def: used after amounts to show that the amount is the lowest possible
examples: It'll take a year, at the very least.

idioms.def: without making something seem better, worse, more serious, etc. than it really is
examples: I was surprised, to say the least.

related: (choose, follow, take, etc.) the line/path of least resistance

examples: He always turns up just when you least expect him.
She chose the least expensive of the hotels.
I never hid the truth, least of all from you.
We had to settle for the least worst option (= the best of several options that were all bad).
It'll cost at least 500 dollars.
She must be at least 40.
Cut the grass at least once a week in summer.
I've known her at least as long as you have.

meanings.def: used to add a positive comment about a negative situation
examples: She may be slow but at least she's reliable.

meanings.def: even if nothing else is true or you do nothing else
examples: You could at least listen to what he says.
Well, at least they weren't bored.

meanings.def: used to limit or make what you have just said less definite
examples: They seldom complained—officially at least.
It works, at least I think it does.

meanings.def: used when mentioning the last person or thing of a group, in order to say that they are not less important than the others
examples: Last but not least, I'd like to thank all the catering staff.

meanings.def: a bad situation will pass or be forgotten most quickly if nothing more is said about it
the best thing to do is say as little as possible about something
(to choose, etc.) the easiest way of doing something

examples: The documentary caused a lot of bad feeling, not least among the workers whose lives it described.
